notes: Tolerates wet soils; exfoliating bark; heat-tolerant selection. A heat-adapted river birch with beautiful peeling bark and strong resistance to leaf spot, ideal for tough Southern landscapes.
Excellent for screening, hedging, and formal landscapes. A refined, durable tree with dense branching and smooth gray bark, perfect for structured or architectural plantings.
Ideal for tight spaces, allees, and formal screens. A stately, columnar hornbeam with dense foliage and a clean architectural form that holds its shape beautifully.
Mildew-resistant; excellent summer color. A vibrant coral-pink crape myrtle with strong disease resistance and a graceful vase shape.
One of the truest purple-flowering crape myrtles. A standout purple-blooming crape myrtle with rich color and a strong, rounded canopy.
One of the longest-blooming crape myrtles. A vigorous, mildew-resistant crape myrtle with soft lavender blooms that persist for months.
Famous cinnamon-colored exfoliating bark. A large, elegant crape myrtle with bright white blooms and striking cinnamon bark that provides year-round interest.
Compact and mildew-resistant. A compact crape myrtle with vivid red blooms and excellent disease resistance, ideal for smaller landscapes.
Early blooming; dense foliage. A compact, early-blooming crape myrtle with bright coral flowers and a tidy, rounded habit.
Strong purple coloration. A richly colored purple crape myrtle with a balanced, upright form and excellent summer performance.
Excellent mildew resistance. A bright pink crape myrtle with strong disease resistance and a refined, upright habit.
Seedless; brilliant red fall color. A seedless red maple known for its uniform shape and intense red fall foliage.
Heat-tolerant sugar maple selection. A tough, heat-tolerant sugar maple with glossy foliage and outstanding golden-orange fall color.
Edible berries; exceptional red-orange fall color. A four-season native tree with early white blooms, edible berries, and brilliant fall color.
Massive blooms; highly disease resistant. A show-stopping dogwood with enormous white blooms and excellent disease resistance.
Unique green-tinted blooms. A distinctive flowering dogwood with soft green-tinted bracts that mature to creamy white.
Thrives in wet soils; fast-growing. A graceful, fast-growing tree with long, pendulous branches that thrive in moist areas.
Fast-growing; excellent red fall color. A strong, adaptable oak with fast growth and vibrant red fall foliage.
Highly disease resistant; excellent street tree. A narrow, upright Chinese elm with exceptional disease resistance and attractive mottled bark.
Famous for mass spring bloom. A beloved flowering cherry known for its clouds of pale pink blooms in early spring.
Double blooms resemble pom-poms. A showy cherry tree with large, double pink blossoms that create a dramatic spring display.
Blooms twice a year. A unique cherry that flowers lightly in fall and again in spring, extending the bloom season.
Highly fragrant winter blooms. A winter-blooming apricot with intensely fragrant rose-pink flowers that appear before the leaves.
Graceful cascading branches. A compact weeping cherry with soft pink spring blooms and elegant, fountain-like branching.
Heavy spring bloom; compact form. A popular weeping cherry with cascading branches covered in pure white spring flowers.
Bright golden new foliage. A colorful redbud with lavender spring blooms and brilliant golden foliage that holds color well.
Unique architectural branching. A distinctive redbud with quirky, angular branching and classic pink spring blooms.
One of the brightest redbud bloom colors. A striking redbud known for its intensely vivid magenta-red spring flowers.
Glossy burgundy foliage; drought tolerant. A compact redbud with glossy, wine-colored foliage and rosy-pink blooms.
Native; early pollinator resource. A beloved native tree with early pink blooms that appear before the foliage.
Deep burgundy foliage. A compact weeping redbud with cascading branches and rich burgundy foliage.
Multicolored foliage: red, orange, yellow, and green. A spectacular redbud with constantly changing foliage colors, creating a rainbow effect through the season.
Bright red new growth. A colorful redbud with vivid red new foliage that matures to deep green.
Part of the Garden Gems dwarf series. A compact redbud with vibrant pink-purple blooms and a tidy, rounded habit ideal for small landscapes.
Bright green foliage; vigorous grower. A vigorous redbud with clean, bright green foliage and classic pink spring blooms.
Dwarf habit; excellent for small gardens. A dwarf redbud with a compact form and bright pink blooms, perfect for tight spaces.
Golden foliage; extremely narrow habit. A striking columnar redbud with golden foliage and a narrow, cascading form ideal for tight vertical spaces.
Multicolored foliage: pink, white, burgundy, and green. A showy redbud with stunning variegated foliage that shifts through pink, burgundy, and green tones.
Deep purple foliage in spring. A classic purple-leaf redbud with rich burgundy foliage and abundant rosy-pink blooms.
Slow-growing dwarf form. A miniature ginkgo with dense branching and bright golden fall color, ideal for small spaces or containers.
Male selection; brilliant fall color. A stately male ginkgo known for its symmetrical form and intense golden fall foliage.
Exceptional fall color; heat tolerant. A tough, drought-tolerant tree prized for its brilliant orange-red fall foliage.
Semi-evergreen to evergreen in the South. A fragrant, semi-evergreen magnolia with upright multi-stem form and creamy white blooms.
Late blooming avoids frost damage. A compact magnolia with tulip-shaped purple-red blooms that open later than most magnolias.
Compact; late blooming. A small magnolia with deep reddish-purple blooms that appear later in spring, reducing frost risk.
Heavy bloomer. A prolific blooming star magnolia with soft pink flowers that cover the branches in early spring.
Rare yellow magnolia. A striking magnolia with yellow-orange blooms and a narrow, upright form.
Tolerates wet or dry soils. A refined bald cypress with soft, feathery foliage and excellent adaptability to wet or dry conditions.
Highly fragrant blooms. A compact weeping snowbell with cascading branches and intensely fragrant white flowers.
Rare pink-flowering snowbell. A charming snowbell with soft pink bell-shaped blooms that hang delicately from the branches.
Dark purple foliage. A dramatic snowbell with deep purple foliage that contrasts beautifully with its white bell-shaped blooms.
Heavy bloomer. A compact snowbell with masses of white bell-shaped flowers that cover the branches in late spring.
Dark foliage; compact habit. A compact snowbell with dark foliage and abundant white blooms that contrast beautifully against the leaves.
Native; highly fragrant blooms. A native tree with clouds of fragrant white fringe-like flowers that appear in late spring.
Large white single flowers in fall. A vigorous sasanqua with clean white blooms and an upright habit.
Compact spreading habit; semi-double rose-pink flowers. One of the most popular low-growing camellias for foundation plantings.
Narrow upright form with red blooms and yellow stamens. A columnar sasanqua ideal for tight spaces and vertical accents.
Strongly upright, columnar habit. An excellent narrow sasanqua for screening and tight vertical plantings.
Soft pink fall blooms. A graceful sasanqua with abundant pink flowers in autumn.

Vivid pink-red blooms. A vigorous sasanqua with eye-catching fall flowers.
Deep ruby-pink peony-form blooms. A vigorous, upright sasanqua with rich burgundy-toned flowers.
Delicate pink blooms in fall. A graceful sasanqua with abundant flowering and an elegant habit.
Pink fall blooms. A reliable sasanqua with a tidy upright habit.
Contorted/twisted branching adds winter interest. A unique sasanqua with corkscrew branches and pink fall blooms.
Extended bloom from late fall into early winter. A sasanqua-type camellia that bridges fall and winter bloom seasons.
Soft pink blooms. A charming sasanqua with delicate pink flowers and a graceful habit.
Hybrid (japonica  lutchuensis). One of the most fragrant camellias available, with large peony-form blooms in ivory-pink.
Late-blooming japonica with red anemone-form flowers in March-April. Extends the camellia season into spring.
Deep red semi-double to peony-form blooms. A classic late-season japonica with rich crimson flowers.

Late-blooming pink japonica. Extends the camellia season into mid-spring.
Pink semi-double to peony-form blooms. A classic japonica with elegant pink flowers.
Pure white semi-double blooms. An elegant white japonica with a clean, classic look.

Spanish-type lavender with showy blooms. A reliable, fragrant lavender for hot, sunny sites.

One of the most cold-hardy rosemary selections. A reliable, upright rosemary for culinary and ornamental use.
Tall, strongly upright habit with broad leaves. A vigorous, columnar rosemary with intense flavor and bold blue flowers.
Sterile hybrid; blooms continuously without going to seed. A top pollinator plant with ornamental purple-veined foliage.
Downy mildew resistant sweet basil. A breakthrough culinary basil that stays healthy when others succumb to disease.
Tightly curled leaves; biennial grown as annual. Host plant for swallowtail butterflies.
Flat-leaf variety; stronger flavor than curled. Preferred culinary parsley; host plant for swallowtails.
Variegated foliage in green, white, and pink. An ornamental culinary sage with striking tricolor leaves.
Purple-tinted foliage; culinary and ornamental. A beautiful dual-purpose sage with smoky purple leaves.
Extra-large rounded leaves; rarely flowers. A top culinary sage with broad, silvery-green foliage and excellent texture.
White-edged variegated foliage. An ornamental thyme with silver-white leaf margins and culinary use.
Lemon-scented golden foliage. A bright, citrusy thyme with ornamental and culinary value.
Aggressive spreader  best in containers. A vigorous mint with strong peppermint flavor and aroma.
Striking red-veined foliage; edible leaves with lemony flavor. An ornamental herb that doubles as an eye-catching garden accent.
One of the top native pollinator plants. A tough native herb with silvery bracts and intense minty fragrance that bees love.
